response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age (21)", "medium", "Being a young adult can be associated with higher impulsivity and risk-taking behavior, though age alone is not determinative."),
    ("Race (Black)", "low", "Race in itself is not a reliable predictor; risk assessments should not over-weight race without other contributing factors."),
    ("Prior Arrest History", "medium", "Having one previous arrest—even without a conviction—suggests some level of prior involvement with law enforcement."),
    ("Physical Characteristics", "low", "Height and weight are not significant predictors of recidivism."),
    ("Marital Status & Living Situation", "low", "Never married and living alone suggest limited social support, but this factor is less directly linked to recidivism on its own."),
    ("Education", "medium", "Only having a high school diploma and not pursuing higher education can be associated with lower opportunities and increased risk factors."),
    ("Employment History", "medium", "Holding only one job in the past year may indicate economic instability, which can correlate with increased risk."),
    ("Substance Use (Marijuana and Cocaine)", "high", "Recent and ongoing substance use is strongly linked to a higher likelihood of recidivism."),
    ("Mental Health (Depressive Feelings)", "medium", "Experiencing depressive episodes can impact decision-making and impulse control, thereby increasing risk."),
    ("Childhood Environment", "low", "Growing up in a rural household with a biological parent in a household of moderate size does not significantly elevate risk on its own."),
    ("Religious Beliefs", "medium", "A lack of religious affiliation might indicate fewer community bonds, which can marginally increase risk.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being a young adult can be associated with higher impulsivity and risk-taking behavior, though age alone is not determinative.
Race in itself is not a reliable predictor; risk assessments should not over-weight race without other contributing factors.
Having one previous arrest—even without a conviction—suggests some level of prior involvement with law enforcement.
Height and weight are not significant predictors of recidivism.
Never married and living alone suggest limited social support, but this factor is less directly linked to recidivism on its own.
Only having a high school diploma and not pursuing higher education can be associated with lower opportunities and increased risk factors.
Holding only one job in the past year may indicate economic instability, which can correlate with increased risk.
Recent and ongoing substance use is strongly linked to a higher likelihood of recidivism.
Experiencing depressive episodes can impact decision-making and impulse control, thereby increasing risk.
Growing up in a rural household with a biological parent in a household of moderate size does not significantly elevate risk on its own.
A lack of religious affiliation might indicate fewer community bonds, which can marginally increase risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 7 inches and weighs 149 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in a rural area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
